intro: Eremogone aculeata, commonly known as the spiny eremogone, is a perennial flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant is distinguished by its spiny, glandular leaves and showy yellow to orange capitula that bloom in late summer. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures. Eremogone aculeata is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops.
